dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2319 IS: To designate the Federal building located at 300 West Congress Street in Tucson, Arizona, as the “Raúl M. Grijalva Federal Building”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Kelly (for himself and Mr. Gallego) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To designate the Federal building located at 300 West Congress Street in Tucson, Arizona, as the Raúl M. Grijalva Federal Building.

section.text: The Federal building located at 300 West Congress Street in Tucson, Arizona, shall be known and designated as the Raúl M. Grijalva Federal Building.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the Federal building referred to in section 1 shall be deemed to be a reference to the Raúl M. Grijalva Federal Building.
